row.title: El pronóstico del cáncer
row.field_short_title: El pronóstico del cáncer
row.field_page_description: Tres pacientes con cáncer y su médico, el doctor Anthony L. Back, un oncólogo quien también es experto a nivel nacional en la comunicación entre médicos y pacientes, comparten sus puntos de vista sobre sus pronósticos de cáncer. Conozca los factores clave del pronóstico y cómo hablar del mismo, y obtenga una perspectiva invaluable de la forma muy personal en que cada paciente enfrenta las preguntas sobre el futuro.

row.title: Colorectal Cancer Screening: What to Expect
row.field_short_title: Colorectal Cancer Screening: What to Expect
row.field_page_description: Everyone over the age of 50 should be screened for colorectal cancer. Learn about the three screening methods that work to reduce the chance of death from colorectal cancer: colonoscopy, sigmoidoscopy, and home stool test. Also hear personal stories from people who have gone through colorectal cancer screening.

row.title: The Changing Landscape of Lung Cancer Research and Treatment - Google Hangout
row.field_short_title: The Changing Landscape of Lung Cancer Research and Treatment
row.field_page_description: Along with the Lung Cancer Social Media (#LCSM) community, the National Cancer Institute will be co-hosting a lively and interactive Google Hangout on Air about the changing landscape of lung cancer research and treatment. During the chat, viewers will have the opportunity to pose questions to a panel of lung cancer experts including NCI's Dr. Shakun Malik, the head of thoracic oncology therapeutics, Roy S. Herbst, MD, PhD, Chief of Medical Oncology, Yale Cancer Center and Smilow Cancer Hospital at Yale-New Haven and David Tom Cooke MD FACS, Head, Section of General Thoracic Surgery University
row.field_list_description:
Along with the Lung Cancer Social Media (#LCSM) community, the National Cancer Institute will be co-hosting a lively and interactive Google Hangout on Air about the changing landscape of lung cancer research and treatment. During the chat, viewers will have the opportunity to pose questions to a panel of lung cancer experts including NCI's Dr. Shakun Malik, the head of thoracic oncology therapeutics, Roy S. Herbst, MD, PhD, Chief of Medical Oncology, Yale Cancer Center and Smilow Cancer Hospital at Yale-New Haven and David Tom Cooke MD FACS, Head, Section of General Thoracic Surgery University of California, Davis. You can also learn more and follow along on the #LCSM Chat page. The chat will be moderated by lung cancer advocate and #LCSM co-founder, Janet Freeman-Daily.
To ask questions of our experts, simply use the #LCSM hashtag during the chat.

row.field_caption: Thyroid cancer represents the 8th most common cancer in the United States, but is highly treatable and usually curable. This video provides key facts, including statistics.

row.title: Genomic Data Commons and Genomic Cloud Pilots - Google Hangout
row.field_short_title: Genomic Data Commons and Genomic Cloud Pilots - Google Hangout
row.field_page_description: Join us for a live, moderated discussion about two NCI efforts to expand access to cancer genomics data: the Genomic Data Commons and Genomic Cloud Pilots. NCI subject matters experts will include Louis M. Staudt, M.D., Ph.D., Director Center for Cancer Genomics, Warren Kibbe, Ph.D., Director, NCI Center for Biomedical Informatics and Information Technology, and moderated by Anthony Kerlavage, Ph.D., Chief, Cancer Informatics Branch, Center for Biomedical Informatics and Information Technology. We welcome your questions before and during the Hangout on Twitter using the hashtag #AskNCI.

row.title: Status of Cancer | Did You Know?
row.field_short_title: Status of Cancer | Did You Know?
row.field_page_description: The Status of Cancer is an update on the rate of new cancer cases, deaths, and the most common cancers in the United States. Data from 1975 to 2012 provide trends in cancer rates among people from all racial and ethnic backgrounds combined. Watch this video to find out which cancers have declined, which have increased, and what steps can be taken to reduce the risk.

row.field_page_description: NCI’s Jeff Abrams, M.D., Acting Director for Clinical Research in the Division of Cancer Treatment and Diagnosis (DCTD) and Associate Director of the Cancer Therapy Evaluation Program (CTEP) and Nita Seibel, M.D., Head of the Pediatric Solid Tumor Therapeutics in the Clinical Investigations Branch of CTEP, DCTD will host a Google Hangout on Air. Listen to the discussion about "National Clinical Trials Network: Progress and Lessons Learned," including the latest information related to precision medicine in cancer, as well as two NCI precision medicine clinical trials: NCI-MATCH and NCI-Pediatric MATCH.

NCI’s Jeff Abrams, M.D., Acting Director for Clinical Research in the Division of Cancer Treatment and Diagnosis (DCTD) and Associate Director of the Cancer Therapy Evaluation Program (CTEP) and Nita Seibel, M.D., Head of the Pediatric Solid Tumor Therapeutics in the Clinical Investigations Branch of CTEP, DCTD hosted a Google Hangout on Air. row.title: The Science of Cancer Prevention
row.field_short_title: The Science of Cancer Prevention
row.field_page_description: The science of cancer prevention is described by Dr. Barnett S. Kramer, M.D., M.P.H., former director of NCI's Division of Cancer Prevention (DCP). DCP administers a broad spectrum of research that spans basic preclinical, laboratory research, supportive and palliative care research, early detection, and randomized controlled clinical trials. The division also supports the Cancer Prevention Fellowship Program and is devoted to the balanced communication of scientific results.
row.field_feature_card_description: In this video, Dr. Barry Kramer, former director of NCI's Division of Cancer Prevention, discusses the science of cancer prevention and some of the prevention research that NCI is funding.

row.title: Killing Cancer Cells with the Help of Infrared Light – Photoimmunotherapy
row.field_short_title: Killing Cancer Cells with the Help of Infrared Light – Photoimmunotherapy
row.field_page_description: Near-infrared photoimmunotherapy uses an antibody–photoabsorber conjugate that binds to cancer cells. When near-infrared light is applied, the cells swell and then burst, causing the cancer cell to die. Photoimmunotherapy is in clinical trials in patients with inoperable tumors.

row.title: The Outstanding Investigator Award (R35)
row.field_short_title: The Outstanding Investigator Award (R35)
row.field_page_description: NCI established the Outstanding Investigator Award (R35) in 2014, for principal investigators who have achieved significant research accomplishments. Featured in this video is Holly Prigerson, Ph.D., of Weill Cornell Medicine, who is among the first group of 62 researchers to receive the award. The R35 encourages these outstanding investigators to take on high-risk and potentially high-reward research projects by providing stable funding for 7 years.

row.title: Comunidades hispanas – Panel Listón Azul 2016
row.field_short_title: Comunidades hispanas – Panel Listón Azul 2016
row.field_page_description: En su discurso sobre el Estado de la Unión el 12 de enero de 2016, el presidente Barack Obama anunció el establecimiento de una nueva Misión contra el Cáncer para acelerar la investigación oncológica. Esta misión tiene el objetivo de poner más terapias a disposición de más pacientes, al mismo tiempo que se mejora nuestra habilidad de prevenir el cáncer y de detectarlo en un estadio inicial. Para ayudar con la formulación de sus recomendaciones, se indicó a la brigada de trabajo que consulte con expertos externos de los sectores científicos, incluyendo el Consejo Nacional Consultivo de Cáncer (
row.field_list_description: En su discurso sobre el Estado de la Unión el 12 de enero de 2016, el presidente Barack Obama anunció el establecimiento de una nueva Misión contra el Cáncer para acelerar la investigación oncológica. Esta misión tiene el objetivo de poner más terapias a disposición de más pacientes, al mismo tiempo que se mejora nuestra habilidad de prevenir el cáncer y de detectarlo en un estadio inicial. Para ayudar con la formulación de sus recomendaciones, se indicó a la brigada de trabajo que consulte con expertos externos de los sectores científicos, incluyendo el Consejo Nacional Consultivo de Cáncer (NCAB). En este video, la doctora María Elena Martínez, miembro del panel, habla de cómo la iniciativa afectará a la comunidad hispana.

row.title: Proteogenomics Research: On the Frontier of Precision Medicine
row.field_short_title: Proteogenomics Research: On the Frontier of Precision Medicine
row.field_feature_card_description: Separately, genomics and proteomics provide a partial picture of cancer biology. Studying them together via proteogenomics research produces a more unified picture of cancer.
row.field_browser_title: Proteogenomics Research: On the Frontier of Precision Medicine
row.field_card_title: Proteogenomics Research: On the Frontier of Precision Medicine
row.field_caption: Separately, genomics and proteomics provide a partial picture of cancer biology. Studying them together via proteogenomics research produces a more unified picture of cancer. Researchers are hopeful that proteogenomics, the integrated study of proteomics and genomics, may improve our ability to prevent, diagnose, and treat cancer at the molecular level using precision medicine.

row.title: Dr. Ted Trimble: Why I Do Cancer Research
row.field_short_title: Dr. Ted Trimble: Why I Do Cancer Research
row.field_page_description: In a video, Dr. Ted Trimble talks about the importance of cancer research. World Cancer Research Day commemorates the important role research and cancer researchers play in reducing the global burden of cancer.

row.field_list_description: In a video, Dr. Ted Trimble talks about the importance of cancer research. World Cancer Research Day commemorates the important role research and cancer researchers play in reducing the global burden of cancer.
row.field_browser_title: Dr. Ted Trimble: Why I Do Cancer Research
row.field_card_title: Dr. Ted Trimble: Why I Do Cancer Research
row.field_caption: Dr. Ted Trimble, Director of the National Cancer Institute’s Center for Global Health, shares why he has committed his career to cancer research, and why global research and partnerships are key to accelerating progress against cancer. World Cancer Research Day, September 24, 2017, is a day of recognition for the critical cancer research being done around the world.

row.title: President Roosevelt's 1940 Dedication of the First NCI Building
row.field_short_title: President Roosevelt's 1940 Dedication of the First NCI Building
row.field_page_description: Watch this video excerpt of the dedication of the National Institute of Health, October 31, 1940. President Roosevelt spoke of the importance of the National Cancer Institute, which would be located in Building 6.
row.field_list_description: On October 31, 1940, President Franklin D. Roosevelt delivered a speech dedicating the first six buildings of the new National Institute of Health in Bethesda, Maryland. In this video excerpt, President Roosevelt remarks on the importance of the National Cancer Institute, which had been authorized by Congress in 1937 and which would be located in Building 6 on the new NIH campus.
row.field_browser_title: President Roosevelt's 1940 Dedication of the First NCI Building
row.field_card_title: President Roosevelt's 1940 Dedication of the First NCI Building
row.field_caption: On October 31, 1940, President Franklin D. Roosevelt delivered a speech dedicating the first six buildings of the new National Institute of Health in Bethesda, Maryland. Building 6, as noted in this video excerpt, was NCI's first official building.

row.title: Understanding CTD<sup>2<,sup> Dashboard Organization and Terminology
row.field_short_title: CTD<sup>2</sup> Dashboard Overview

row.field_feature_card_description: An overview of the CTD<sup>2</sup> Dashboard
row.field_list_description: The CTD<sup>2</sup> Dashboard aims to provide easy exploration of genomics data to a broad range of scientists for translational research. This video introduces and defines common terminology used throughout the Dashboard.
row.field_browser_title: CTD<sup>2</sup> Dashboard Overview
row.field_card_title: CTD<sup>2</sup> Dashboard Overview
row.field_caption: The Cancer Target Discovery and Development (CTD2) initiative was established to help translate genomic research into future effective cancer treatments. The CTD2 Dashboard aims to provide easy exploration of data to a broad range of scientists. This video introduces and defines common terminology used throughout the Dashboard.

row.field_page_description: Learn how the NCI Community Oncology Research Program (NCORP) supports research to improve the availability, quality, cost, and outcomes of cancer care.

row.field_list_description: The NCI Community Oncology Research Program (NCORP) supports research examining how patient and clinician behavior, organizational structures, health technologies, and financing approaches can influence the availability, quality, cost, and outcomes of cancer care.

row.title: The Role of Immunotherapy in Childhood Cancer Treatment Facebook Live
row.field_short_title: The Role of Immunotherapy in Childhood Cancer Treatment
row.field_page_description: A Facebook Live discussing the role of immunotherapy in childhood cancer.
row.field_browser_title: Immunotherapy in Childhood Cancer Treatment - Facebook Live Video
row.field_card_title: The Role of Immunotherapy in Childhood Cancer Treatment
row.field_caption: Dr. Nirali Shah of the National Cancer Institute joined by Carlos Sandi, childhood cancer parent, discuss the role of immunotherapy in childhood cancers such as leukemia.
row.body: On October 25,2018, the National Cancer Institute hosted a Facebook Live on the role of immunotherapy in childhood cancers such as leukemia. Dr. Nirali Shah of the National Cancer Institute was joined by Carlos Sandi, St. Baldrick’s Foundation advocate and childhood cancer parent. Together they discussed how research and advocacy play a role in advancing treatment for childhood cancer.

row.title: Nonspecific Immune Stimulation
row.field_short_title: Nonspecific Immune Stimulation
row.field_page_description: Immunotherapy uses the body's immune system to fight cancer. This animation explains one type of immunotherapy called nonspecific immune stimulation that is used to treat cancer.
row.field_browser_title: Nonspecific Immune Stimulation
row.field_card_title: Nonspecific Immune Stimulation
row.field_caption: Learn about nonspecific immune stimulation, one type of immunotherapy used to treat cancer.
row.body: How is the immune system used to fight cancer? This animation explains one type of immunotherapy that boosts the ability of the body’s immune system to rid the body of cancer.

row.field_page_description: NCI's Cancer Center Cessation Initiative, part of the Cancer Moonshot℠, aims to help patients at cancer centers across the country quit tobacco successfully.

row.title: What's Next in Liver Cancer Research Twitter Live
row.field_short_title: What's Next in Liver Cancer Research
row.field_page_description: A Twitter Live discussing research on liver cancer etiology and prevention.
row.field_browser_title: What's Next in Liver Cancer Research Twitter Live
row.field_card_title: What's Next in Liver Cancer Research
row.body: The National Cancer Institute hosted its first Twitter Live on October 30. The event featured NCI experts Anuradha S. Budhu, Ph.D. and Tim Greten, M.D. of the Center for Cancer Research as well as Katherine McGlynn, Ph.D. of the Division of Cancer Epidemiology and Genetics. They discussed their research on liver cancer etiology and prevention.

row.title: Genomics: How DNA Can Inform Cancer Diagnosis and Treatment
row.field_short_title: Genomics: How DNA Can Inform Cancer Diagnosis and Treatment
row.field_page_description: The National Cancer Institute hosted a Facebook Live on February 14, at 3 p.m. ET. The event featured NCI subject matter experts Kenneth Aldape, M.D., of the Center for Cancer Research, Megan Frone, M.S., C.G.C., of the Division of Cancer Epidemiology and Genetics, and Lyndsay Harris, M.D., of the Cancer Diagnosis Prog
row.field_feature_card_description: NCI experts Kenneth Aldape, M.D., Megan Frone, M.S., C.G.C., and Lyndsay Harris, M.D., discuss the role of genetics in cancer diagnosis and treatment.
row.field_list_description: The National Cancer Institute hosted a Facebook Live on February 14, at 3 p.m. ET. The event featured NCI subject matter experts Kenneth Aldape, M.D., of the Center for Cancer Research, Megan Frone, M.S., C.G.C., of the Division of Cancer Epidemiology and Genetics, and Lyndsay Harris, M.D., of the Cancer Diagnosis Program. They discussed the role of genetics in cancer diagnosis and treatment. At the end of the event, experts answered live questions from viewers.

row.title: A Dialogue on Cancer Disparities, Prevention, and Research
row.field_short_title: A Dialogue on Cancer Disparities, Prevention, and Research
row.field_page_description: The National Cancer Institute (NCI) hosted a Facebook Live on A Dialogue on Cancer Disparities, Prevention, and Research. The event featured Worta McCaskill-Stevens, M.D., M.S., National Cancer Institute, Brid M. Ryan, Ph.D., M.P.H., National Cancer Institute, and Christina Dieli-Conwright, Ph.D., M.P.H., University of Southern California. They discussed cancer disparities, and the work being done to help reduce cancer disparities.

row.title: Cancer Clinical Trials in Your Community - NCI Community Oncology Research Program (NCORP)
row.field_short_title: Cancer Clinical Trials in Your Community
row.field_page_description: This video introduces the NCI Community Oncology Research Program (NCORP), a nationwide network that brings cancer research studies to people in their communities. NCORP investigators also explain what the program offers to their patients and some benefits of clinical trials.
row.field_browser_title: Cancer Clinical Trials in Your Community
row.field_card_title: Cancer Clinical Trials in Your Community
row.field_caption: The NCI Community Oncology Research Program (NCORP) is a national NCI-supported network that brings cancer clinical trials and cancer care delivery research studies to people in their communities.
